attributes.action: sort out gang violence on the streets
attributes.additional_details: because they are the only people that can do it. if civilians try do something they will be stabbed or shot because they are in the way
attributes.background: to take the shanks and straps off gms/ drug dealers in hillingdon

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about gang violence, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Decisions about investigating and prosecuting alleged crimes are a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or Parliament.

If you are concerned about policing in your area you could raise this with your local Police and Crime Commissioner, who is responsible for overseeing police forces in your area. You can find out who your local Police and Crime Commissioner is here: https://www.apccs.police.uk/find-your-pcc/
